pinyin: Nuo4 bei4 er3 Wu4 li3 xue2 Jiang3

definition: texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up

sentences.english: Congratulations to Professor Kao on your Nobel Prize in Physics.
sentences.chinese: 祝贺高教授获得诺贝尔物理学奖。

sentences.english: So, let's give him his credit, Nobel in physics.
sentences.chinese: 让我们向他崇高的敬意，诺贝尔物理学奖。

sentences.english: He was awarded the Nobel Prize for physics.
sentences.chinese: 他被授予诺贝尔物理学奖。

sentences.english: Einstein won the Nobel Prize for physics in 1921.
sentences.chinese: 1921年爱因斯坦曾荣获诺贝尔物理学奖金。

sentences.english: Daniel C. Tsui is the 1998 Nobel laureate in Physics.
sentences.chinese: 华裔科学家崔琦是1998年诺贝尔物理学奖获得者。

sentences.english: Prof. Laughlin is the co-recipient of the 1998 Nobel Prize for physics.
sentences.chinese: 劳克林曾经获得过1998年的诺贝尔物理学奖。

definition: Tsung-Dao Lee (1926-), Chinese American physicist, Columbia University, 1957 Nobel laureate
Fields Medal (for mathematics, approximate equivalent to Nobel Prize)
Fermi (name)/Enrico Fermi (1901-1954), Italian born US nuclear physicist
Nobel Prize/abbr. for 諾貝爾獎|诺贝尔奖[Nuo4 bei4 er3 Jiang3]
Samuel C. C. Ting (1936-), American physicist, 1976 Nobel Prize laureate in physics
Roger Yonchien Tsien (1952-), US Chinese chemist and 2008 Nobel laureate
the Wolf prize (for science and arts)
Enrico Fermi (1901-1954), Italian born US nuclear physicist
Henri Poincaré (1854-1912), French mathematician, physician and philosopher
Shing-Tung Yau (1949-), Chinese-American mathematician, Fields medalist in 1982
